chargeHist.descr: Child Sexual Exploitation - Produce, Perform, etc.
Child Sexual Exploitation - Produce, Perform, etc.

result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith Knutsen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Causing Mental Harm to Child, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.04(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 460 days sentence credit.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.
Court will allow for probation to be transferred out of state through the Inter-state compact.  Court will allow transfer to any other county.

miscConds.notes: Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Sex offender treatment.
Compliance with sex offender registry.
Not to possess any pornography.
No unsupervised contact with any minor children.
No use or possession of any devices with internet access without Agents approval.
No use or possession of any illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.  Court will allow to be served through any other county.
Defendant to be transferred to Huber FORTHWITH.

records.addlTxt:
Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Keith  Knutsen in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   

State moves to amend to one count of a class F Felony.
Amended Information Filed.
Defense has no objections.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  12 Years.
Initial Confinement:  7 Years.
Extended Supervision:  5 Years.
460 Days Credit.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation:  7.5 Years.
Court will allow for probation to be transferred out of State through the inter-state compact.
Court will also allow transfer to anyother county.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Sex offender treatment.
Conpliance with sex offender registry.
Not to possess any pornography.
No Unsupervised Contact with Any Minor Children.
No Use or Possesion of any devices with internet access without agents prior approval.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Court will allow to be served through any other county.
Defendant to be transferred to Huber - Forthwith.    


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
